message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper discusses the implementation of NFV in mobile networks and proposes a framework for virtualized evolved packet core. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is also a likely category as the paper discusses the challenges and requirements of implementing NFV in mobile networks, which involves information processing and transmission. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possible category as the paper proposes a new methodology (NFV) to change the core structure of telecommunications infrastructure to be more cost-efficient. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is a possible category as the paper discusses the grouping of multiple functions of a virtualized evolved packet core in a single physical device or a group of adjacent devices to reduce signaling traffic and achieve better performance. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) is a less likely category as the paper does not focus on the hardware architecture aspect of NFV implementation.
